job_description:
Morson Canada is seeking an experienced avionics engineer to join our team.

Responsibilities:

Take responsibility for various tasks related to the development, testing, certification, production, and in-service support of Avionics Systems for state-of-the-art business aircraft.
Define and manage overall systems and subsystems requirements to ensure compliance with safety, certification, aircraft design requirements, and objectives.
Collaborate with system suppliers and interfacing suppliers to ensure smooth integration of the Avionics system into the aircraft design.
Manage the timely integration of systems, including AFCS, Communication (VHF, HF, SATCOM, Datalink), Navigation (ADF, VOR, ILS, DME, TCAS, Transponder, IRS, GPS, FMS, Weather Radar), Displays (EFIS, EICAS, HUD, SVS), Information/Maintenance & Recording (IMS, OMS, Data load, CVR, FDR, AHMS), Cabin connectivity, etc.
Write, conduct, or witness development and certification tests on the aircraft or test rigs.
Review, analyze, and approve test results.
Contribute to ARP4754 system and aircraft verification and validation activities.
Manage, review, and approve deliverables from Avionics System Suppliers.
Collaborate with Certifying Authorities and support system certification activities.
Provide support to the Final Assembly Line and In-Service Aircraft for design-related issues and ensure their resolution.
Participate in the development and implementation of tools and processes to meet organizational objectives.
Participate in the development and implementation of software for customization of crew alerting logic, synoptics pages, I/O configuration in an IMA environment, and automation of aircraft-level functions.

Qualifications:

As our ideal candidate,

You hold a university degree in Electrical, Electronics, Software, Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent.
We have openings ranging from entry level (3 years) to senior engineer positions.
You have a strong knowledge of Avionics Systems and their integration within an aircraft.
Knowledge and/or experience with Integrated Modular Avionics (IMA) systems is considered an asset.
You possess knowledge of specification, design, integration, test, and certification of Avionics systems on aircraft.
Familiarity with industry standards such as DO-178, DO-160, DO-254, and ARP4754 is desired.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Excellent problem-solving skills, work planning structure, and prioritization abilities.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Willingness to travel as required.
